meanings.definition: To attract or entice someone or something
meanings.sent1: The advertisement lures customers to the store.
meanings.sent2: The promise of a reward lures the dog to obey commands.
meanings.sent3: The delicious smell of cookies lures kids into the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The mysterious sound lures explorers into the cave.
meanings.sent5: The bright lights of the city lures tourists from all over the world.

meanings.definition: A device used for attracting and catching fish
meanings.sent1: The fisherman used a shiny lure to catch a big fish.
meanings.sent2: The fishing store sells a variety of lures for different types of fish.
meanings.sent3: The wiggling lure in the water caught the fish's attention.
meanings.sent4: The fisherman's favorite lure was the one that glowed in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The old lure had been used so much that it was missing some paint.
